alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Monroe; Morgan; Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:13AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Monroe, Morgan, northwestern Johnson, Hendricks, northeastern Owen and western Marion Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 112 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to 10 miles northeast of Spencer. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Danville around 120 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Brownsburg, Martinsville, Speedway and Mooresville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 118 and 127. Interstate 70 between mile markers 50 and 78. Interstate 74 between mile markers 63 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Monroe; Morgan; Owen
